MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKTypeface MatchCharacter (string familyName, string[] bcp47, char character);
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKTypeface MatchCharacter(string familyName, string[] bcp47, char character) cil managed

Docs.param: The family name to use when searching.
The ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 code to use when searching, such as “ja” and “zh”.
The character to find a typeface for.
Docs.summary: Use the system fallback to find a typeface for the given character.
Docs.returns: Returns the that containes the given character, or if none was found.
Docs.remarks: Note that is a combination of ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 codes, so it is fine to just pass a ISO 639 here. The first item is the least significant fallback, and the last is the most significant. If no specified codes match, any font with the requested character will be matched.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKTypeface MatchCharacter (string familyName, string[] bcp47, int character);
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKTypeface MatchCharacter(string familyName, string[] bcp47, int32 character) cil managed

Docs.param: The family name to try and use.
The ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 code to use when searching, such as “ja” and “zh”.
The character to find a typeface for.
Docs.summary: Use the system fallback to find a typeface for the given character.
Docs.returns: Returns the that containes the given character, or if none was found.
Docs.remarks: Note that is a combination of ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 codes, so it is fine to just pass a ISO 639 here. The first item is the least significant fallback, and the last is the most significant. If no specified codes match, any font with the requested character will be matched.
